entry.title: folke/tokyonight.nvim
entry.summary:
üèô A clean, dark Neovim theme written in Lua, with support for lsp, treesitter and lots of plugins. Includes additional themes for Kitty, Alacritty, iTerm and Fish.

üèô Tokyo Night

A dark and light Neovim theme written in Lua ported from the Visual Studio Code TokyoNight theme. Includes extra themes for Kitty, Alacritty, iTerm and Fish.

Storm

Night

Moon

Day

‚ú® Features

  • Supports the latest Neovim 0.9.0 features.
  • Enhances terminal colors.
  • Introduces a darker background option for sidebar-like windows.
  • Supports all major plugins.
  • Provides TokyoNight extras for numerous other applications.

üç≠ Extras

  • Alacritty (alacritty)
  • Delta (delta)
  • Dunst (dunst)
  • Fish (fish)
  • Fish Themes (fish_themes)
  • Foot (foot)
  • Fzf (fzf)
  • GitUI (gitui)
  • Helix (helix)
  • iTerm (iterm)
  • Kitty (kitty)
  • Lua Table for testing (lua)
  • Prism (prism)
  • Sublime Text (sublime)
  • Terminator (terminator)
  • Tilix (tilix)
  • Tmux (tmux)
  • WezTerm (wezterm)
  • Windows Terminal (windows_terminal)
  • Xfce Terminal (xfceterm)
  • Xresources (xresources)
  • Yazi (yazi)
  • Zathura (zathura)
  • Zellij (zellij)

‚ö°Ô∏è Requirements

  • Neovim >= 0.8.0

üì¶ Installation

Install the theme with your preferred package manager, such as folke/lazy.nvim:

{
  "folke/tokyonight.nvim",
  lazy = false,
  priority = 1000,
  opts = {},
}

üöÄ Usage

Vim Script

colorscheme tokyonight

" There are also colorschemes for the different styles.
colorscheme tokyonight-night
colorscheme tokyonight-storm
colorscheme tokyonight-day
colorscheme tokyonight-moon

Lua

vim.cmd[[colorscheme tokyonight]]

External Plugins

Barbecue
-- Lua
require('barbecue').setup {
  -- ... your barbecue config
  theme = 'tokyonight',
  -- ... your barbecue config
}
Lualine
-- Lua
require('lualine').setup {
  options = {
    -- ... your lualine config
    theme = 'tokyonight'
    -- ... your lualine config
  }
}
Lightline
" Vim Script
let g:lightline = {'colorscheme': 'tokyonight'}

‚öôÔ∏è Configuration

‚ùóÔ∏è Set the configuration BEFORE loading the color scheme with colorscheme tokyonight.

The theme offers four styles: storm, moon, night, and day.

The day style is used when { style = "day" } is passed to setup(options) or when vim.o.background = "light".

TokyoNight uses the default options, unless setup is explicitly called.

require("tokyonight").setup({
  -- your configuration comes here
  -- or leave it empty to use the default settings
  style = "storm", -- The theme comes in three styles, `storm`, `moon`, a darker variant `night` and `day`
  light_style = "day", -- The theme is used when the background is set to light
  transparent = false, -- Enable this to disable setting the background color
  terminal_colors = true, -- Configure the colors used when opening a `:terminal` in [Neovim](https://github.com/neovim/neovim)
  styles = {
    -- Style to be applied to different syntax groups
    -- Value is any valid attr-list value for `:help nvim_set_hl`
    comments = { italic = true },
    keywords = { italic = true },
    functions = {},
    variables = {},
    -- Background styles. Can be "dark", "transparent" or "normal"
    sidebars = "dark", -- style for sidebars, see below
    floats = "dark", -- style for floating windows
  },
  sidebars = { "qf", "help" }, -- Set a darker background on sidebar-like windows. For example: `["qf", "vista_kind", "terminal", "packer"]`
  day_brightness = 0.3, -- Adjusts the brightness of the colors of the **Day** style. Number between 0 and 1, from dull to vibrant colors
  hide_inactive_statusline = false, -- Enabling this option, will hide inactive statuslines and replace them with a thin border instead. Should work with the standard **StatusLine** and **LuaLine**.
  dim_inactive = false, -- dims inactive windows
  lualine_bold = false, -- When `true`, section headers in the lualine theme will be bold

  --- You can override specific color groups to use other groups or a hex color
  --- function will be called with a ColorScheme table
  ---@param colors ColorScheme
  on_colors = function(colors) end,

  --- You can override specific highlights to use other groups or a hex color
  --- function will be called with a Highlights and ColorScheme table
  ---@param highlights Highlights
  ---@param colors ColorScheme
  on_highlights = function(highlights, colors) end,
})

ü™ì Overriding Colors & Highlight Groups

How the highlight groups are calculated:

  1. colors are determined based on your configuration, with the ability to override them using config.on_colors(colors).
  2. These colors are utilized to generate the highlight groups.
  3. config.on_highlights(highlights, colors) can be used to override highlight groups.

For default values of colors and highlights, please consult the storm, moon, night, and day themes.

Settings and color alteration demonstration

require("tokyonight").setup({
  -- use the night style
  style = "night",
  -- disable italic for functions
  styles = {
    functions = {}
  },
  sidebars = { "qf", "vista_kind", "terminal", "packer" },
  -- Change the "hint" color to the "orange" color, and make the "error" color bright red
  on_colors = function(colors)
    colors.hint = colors.orange
    colors.error = "#ff0000"
  end
})

Borderless Telescope example

require("tokyonight").setup({
  on_highlights = function(hl, c)
    local prompt = "#2d3149"
    hl.TelescopeNormal = {
      bg = c.bg_dark,
      fg = c.fg_dark,
    }
    hl.TelescopeBorder = {
      bg = c.bg_dark,
      fg = c.bg_dark,
    }
    hl.TelescopePromptNormal = {
      bg = prompt,
    }
    hl.TelescopePromptBorder = {
      bg = prompt,
      fg = prompt,
    }
    hl.TelescopePromptTitle = {
      bg = prompt,
      fg = prompt,
    }
    hl.TelescopePreviewTitle = {
      bg = c.bg_dark,
      fg = c.bg_dark,
    }
    hl.TelescopeResultsTitle = {
      bg = c.bg_dark,
      fg = c.bg_dark,
    }
  end,
})

Fix undercurls in Tmux

To have undercurls show up and in color, add the following to your Tmux configuration file:

# Undercurl
set -g default-terminal "${TERM}"
set -as terminal-overrides ',*:Smulx=\E[4::%p1%dm'  # undercurl support
set -as terminal-overrides ',*:Setulc=\E[58::2::%p1%{65536}%/%d::%p1%{256}%/%{255}%&%d::%p1%{255}%&%d%;m'  # underscore colours - needs tmux-3.0

üç≠ Extras

Extra color configs for Kitty, Alacritty, Fish, WezTerm, iTerm and foot can be found in extras. To use them, refer to their respective documentation.

You can easily use the color palette for other plugins inside your Neovim configuration:

local colors = require("tokyonight.colors").setup() -- pass in any of the config options as explained above
local util = require("tokyonight.util")

aplugin.background = colors.bg_dark
aplugin.my_error = util.lighten(colors.red1, 0.3) -- number between 0 and 1. 0 results in white, 1 results in red1

üî• Contributing

Pull requests are welcome.

For the extras, we use a simple template system that can be used to generate themes for the different styles.

How to add a new extra template:

  1. Create a file like lua/tokyonight/extra/cool-app.lua.

  2. Add the name and output file extension to the extras table in lua/tokyonight/extra/init.lua.

  3. Run the following command to generate new extra themes from the tokyonight plugin directory:

    nvim --headless "+lua require('tokyonight.extra').setup()" +qa

  4. Check the newly created themes in the extra/ directory. Please DO NOT commit them, as they are already automatically built by the CI.

entry.title: BlackINT3/OpenArk
entry.summary:
The Next Generation of Anti-Rookit(ARK) tool for Windows.

OpenArk

Introduction

  • ‰∏≠ÊñáËØ¥Êòé

  • OpenArk is an open source anti-rookit(ARK) tool for Windows. Ark is Anti-Rootkit abbreviated, it aimmed at reversing/programming helper and also users can find out hidden malwares in the OS. More and more powerful features will be supported in future.

Features

  • Process - Process/Thread/Module/Handles/Memory/Window/Token/MemoryScan/PPL etc information view, Unload/Dll Injector x86/x64 also.
  • Kernel - OS Kernel internal toolkit, eg: Memory, Drivers, Hotkey, Callback, Filters, IDT/SDT/NDIS/WFP etc.
  • CoderKit - Helper for coders.
  • Scanner - PE/ELF file parsers, evolved to virus analyzer in future.
  • Bundler - Directory and files could be bundled to one executable file, it also support scripts.
  • ToolRepo - Collect many useful tools that functional complementation each others, for efficient, always thinking.
  • Console - Many useful coammands in here.
  • Language - Support English and Chinese now, more in future.
  • More powerful features in developing...

Distributions

  • Program: one exe binary, no dependence, support 32/64 bit.
  • Supported OS: Windows XP ... Win7 ... Win10 ... Win11 ...

Compile

  • How To Build OpenArk
  • UNONE & KNONE - User & Kernel mode BaseLibrary

Contributing/Donate

  • Issues and Push Request is welcome.
  • If you like that you can click to donate our develop.
  • OpenArk Code Style Guide

Contact

  • Discord
    • https://discord.com/invite/w9A8q9naDY
  • QQ Group
    • Group4: 960562534
    • Group3: 706663529(full)
    • Group2: 535752025(full)
    • Group1: 836208099(full)

Official Links

  • Website: https://openark.blackint3.com/
  • Source: https://github.com/BlackINT3/OpenArk/
  • Manuals: https://openark.blackint3.com/manuals/

entry.title: ZCShou/GoGoGo
entry.summary:

ÂΩ±Ê¢≠ - Áî®‰∫é Android 8.0+ ÁöÑÊó†ÈúÄ ROOT ÊùÉÈôêÁöÑËôöÊãüÂÆö‰Ωç APP

ÁÆÄ‰ªã

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉÂΩ±Ê¢≠ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âü∫‰∫é Android Ë∞ÉËØï API + ÁôæÂ∫¶Âú∞ÂõæÂèäÂÆö‰Ωç SDK ÂÆûÁé∞ÁöÑÂÆâÂçìÂÆö‰Ωç‰øÆÊîπÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÂêåÊó∂ÂÆûÁé∞‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂèØ‰ª•Ëá™Áî±ÊéßÂà∂ÁßªÂä®ÁöÑÊëáÊùÜ„ÄÇ‰ΩøÁî®ÂΩ±Ê¢≠Ôºå‰∏çÈúÄË¶Å ROOT ÊùÉÈôêÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•ÈöèÊÑè‰øÆÊîπËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÂΩìÂâç‰ΩçÁΩÆ‰ª•ÂèäÊ®°ÊãüÁßªÂä®„ÄÇ

  1. Ê∫êÁ†Å‰ªìÂ∫ìÔºöGithubÔºàÊé®ËçêÔºâ„ÄÅGiteeÔºàÈïúÂÉèÔºâ
  2. ‰∏ãËΩΩÂú∞ÂùÄÔºöGithubÔºàÊé®ËçêÔºâ„ÄÅGiteeÔºàÈïúÂÉèÔºâ

Ë≠¶Âëä‰∏Ä

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉÊúÄËøëÔºåÊúâÁΩëÂèãÁõ¥Êé•ÁôΩÂ´ñÂΩ±Ê¢≠ÂêéÊîπÂêç‰∏∫ ==Ê†áÊû™ÂÆö‰Ωç==ÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÊ∑ªÂä†ÂπøÂëäÔºàÈô§‰∫ÜÂä†ÂπøÂëäÔºåÂäüËÉΩÊ≤°Êúâ‰ªª‰ΩïÊîπÂèòÔºâÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÊ≤°ÊúâÊåâÁÖß GPLv3 ÂçèËÆÆÁöÑË¶ÅÊ±ÇËøõË°åÂºÄÊ∫êÔºàÊàëÂ∑≤ÁªèËÅîÁ≥ªËøáËØ•ÁΩëÂèãËøõ‰∫ÜÊèêÈÜíÔºå‰ΩÜÂπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÊî∂Âà∞ÂõûÂ§çÔºâÔºåÂú®Ê≠§ÊèêÈÜíÔºö

  1. ÂºÄÊ∫ê ‚â† ÁôΩÂ´ñÔºåËØ∑ÈÅµÂæ™ÂºÄÊ∫êÂçèËÆÆ
  2. GPL ÁöÑÊ≥ïÂæãÊïàÂäõÂú®ÂõΩÂÜÖÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ËØâËÆºÊ°à‰æãÂæàÂ§öÔºåËØ∑Ëá™Ë°åÊêúÁ¥¢ÔºåÊùÉË°°Âà©Âºä„ÄÇÂΩ±Ê¢≠‰øùÁïôËøΩÁ©∂Áõ∏ÂÖ≥‰æµÊùÉ‰∫∫ÂëòÊ≥ïÂæãË¥£‰ªªÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÊùÉÂà©ÔºÅ
  3. ÂºÄÊ∫ê‰∏çÊòìÔºå‰∏îË°å‰∏îÁèçÊÉú

Ë≠¶Âëä‰∫å

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉÊúÄËøëÔºåÊúâÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫Â∞ÜÂΩ±Ê¢≠Áî®Âú®Ê†°Âõ≠ËøêÂä®Á±ª APPÔºàÂåÖÊã¨‰ΩÜ‰∏çÈôê‰∫éÈó™Âä®Ê†°Âõ≠„ÄÅTakeTwo„ÄÅËøêÂä®‰∏ñÁïåÊ†°Âõ≠Á≠âÔºâ‰∏≠‰ΩúÂºäÔºåÂºÄÂèëËÄÖ‰πüÊî∂Âà∞‰∫ÜÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫ÊèêÈóÆ‰∏∫‰ΩïÂΩ±Ê¢≠ÂÆö‰ΩçÂπ∂‰∏çËµ∑‰ΩúÁî®ÊàñËÄÖÂØªÊ±ÇÂØπÂΩ±Ê¢≠ÁöÑÊîπËøõÔºåÂú®Ê≠§ÊèêÈÜíÔºö

  1. ÂΩ±Ê¢≠‰∏çÊîØÊåÅ‰ªª‰ΩïÊ†°Âõ≠ËøêÂä®Á±ª APP ÁöÑ‰ΩúÂºäË°å‰∏∫
  2. ÂΩ±Ê¢≠ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖ‰πü‰∏çËµûÂêåÈááÁî®‰ªª‰ΩïÂΩ¢ÂºèÂú®Ê†°Âõ≠ËøêÂä®‰∏≠‰ΩúÂºä

ËÉåÊôØ

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉ‰πãÂâçÂú®Áé©‰∏ÄÊ¨æ VR Ê∏∏ÊàèÔºö‰∏ÄËµ∑Êù•ÊçâÂ¶ñ„ÄÇ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÁúÅ‰∫ãÔºåÂ∞±ÊÉ≥ÊúâÊ≤°ÊúâÂèØ‰ª•Êõ¥Êîπ‰ΩçÁΩÆÁöÑ APP„ÄÇÁªèËøá‰∏ÄÁï™Êë∏Á¥¢ÂèëÁé∞Á°ÆÂÆûÊúâ‰∏çÂ∞ëÂèØ‰ª•‰øÆÊîπ‰ΩçÁΩÆÁöÑ APP„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÁªùÂ§ßÂ§öÊï∞ËøôÁßç APP ÈÉΩÊòØÊî∂Ë¥πÁöÑÔºåËÄå‰∏îË¥ºË¥µÔºÅ

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉÊàëÊØîËæÉÊÑüÂÖ¥Ë∂£ÁöÑÊòØËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÊäÄÊúØÊòØÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂÆûÁé∞ÁöÑÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÂÜ≥ÂÆöÁ†îÁ©∂Á†îÁ©∂Ëá™Â∑±ÂÜô‰∏Ä‰∏™ÔºÅÁé∞Âú®Ê∏∏ÊàèÂ∑≤ÁªèÂºÉÂùë‰∫ÜÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÊäÄÊúØ‰∏çËÉΩ‰∏¢„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÂ∞ÜÁ†îÁ©∂ÁªìÊûúÂºÄÊ∫êÂá∫Êù•Êñπ‰æøÂ§ßÂÆ∂‰∏ÄËµ∑Â≠¶‰π†ÔºÅ‰ΩÜÊòØËØ∑Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºàÈáçË¶ÅÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖËØ¥‰∏âÈÅçÔºÅÂê¶ÂàôÂêéÊûúËá™Ë¥üÔºâÔºö

  1. ËØ• APP ‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂ≠¶‰π† Android + ÁôæÂ∫¶Âú∞ÂõæÁöÑÂÆûÁé∞ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºåËØ∑ÂãøÁî®‰∫éÊ∏∏Êàè‰ΩúÂºäÔºÅ
  2. ËØ• APP ‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂ≠¶‰π† Android + ÁôæÂ∫¶Âú∞ÂõæÁöÑÂÆûÁé∞ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºåËØ∑ÂãøÁî®‰∫éÊ∏∏Êàè‰ΩúÂºäÔºÅ
  3. ËØ• APP ‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂ≠¶‰π† Android + ÁôæÂ∫¶Âú∞ÂõæÁöÑÂÆûÁé∞ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºåËØ∑ÂãøÁî®‰∫éÊ∏∏Êàè‰ΩúÂºäÔºÅ

ÂäüËÉΩ

  1. ÂÆö‰Ωç‰øÆÊîπ
  2. ÊëáÊùÜÊéßÂà∂ÁßªÂä®
  3. ÂéÜÂè≤ËÆ∞ÂΩï
  4. ‰ΩçÁΩÆÊêúÁ¥¢
  5. Áõ¥Êé•ËæìÂÖ•ÂùêÊ†á

Êà™Âõæ

Áî®Ê≥ï

  1. ‰∏ãËΩΩ APK Áõ¥Êé•ÂÆâË£Ö
  2. ÂêØÂä®ÂΩ±Ê¢≠ÔºåËµã‰∫àÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÊùÉÈôê
  3. ÂçïÂáªÂú∞Âõæ‰ΩçÁΩÆÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÁÇπÂáªÂêØÂä®ÊåâÈíÆ

ÊñáÊ°£

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉÁî±‰∫éÊú¨‰∫∫Âπ∂‰∏çÊòØÂÅöÁßªÂä®ÂºÄÂèëÁöÑÔºåÂæàÂ§öÂäüËÉΩ‰ª£Á†ÅÂÜôÁöÑÈÉΩÊØîËæÉÂ∑Æ„ÄÇÊàë‰πüÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÂÜô Android APPÔºåÁõÆÂâçËøòÂ§ÑÂú®Â≠¶‰π†‰∏≠„ÄÇ„ÄÇ„ÄÇÊ≠§Â§ñÔºåÂ∞±‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑ APPÔºåÂ∫îËØ•‰πü‰∏çÈúÄË¶ÅÂï•ÊñáÊ°£ÔºåÂºÄÂèëËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ÈÅáÂà∞ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊàë‰∏ÄËà¨ÈÉΩ‰ºöËÆ∞ÂΩïÂú®‰∏™‰∫∫ÂçöÂÆ¢‰∏≠ÔºåÂÖ∑‰ΩìÂèÇËßÅÔºöhttps://blog.csdn.net/zcshoucsdn/category_10559121.html

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉÂ¶ÇÊûúÊúâÁñëÈóÆÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•ÊêúÁ¥¢ ISSUE ÊàñËÄÖ Âú®‰∏äÈù¢Áõ¥Êé•Êèê‰∫§ÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ

ÂèÇËÄÉ

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉÁî±‰∫éÊú¨‰∫∫‰πüÊòØ‰∏™Êñ∞ÊâãÔºåÁ∫ØÂ±û‰∏ö‰ΩôÁûéÊêûÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÂú®ÂÜôÂΩ±Ê¢≠ÁöÑËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ÔºåÂèÇËÄÉ‰∫ÜÂæàÂ§öÁΩëÂèãÂàÜ‰∫´ÁöÑÊäÄÊúØÊñáÁ´†„ÄÅÁ§∫‰æã‰ª£Á†ÅÁ≠â„ÄÇÂåÖÊã¨‰ΩÜ‰∏çÈôê‰∫é‰ª•‰∏ãÂàóÂá∫ÁöÑÂá†‰∏™Ôºö

  1. https://github.com/Hilaver/MockGPS
  2. https://github.com/bxxfighting/together-go
  3. https://github.com/P72B/Mocklation

‚ÄÉ‚ÄÉËøòÊúâ‰∫õ CSDN ‰∏äÁöÑÊñáÁ´†ÔºåÁõÆÂâç‰∏çËÆ∞ÂæóÂú∞ÂùÄ‰∫ÜÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊÇ®ÂèëÁé∞ÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÊúâÁõ¥Êé•ÂºïÁî®ÊàñÂÄüÈâ¥ÊÇ®ÁöÑÂú∞ÊñπÔºåËØ∑‰∏éÊàëËÅîÁ≥ªÔºåÊàë‰ºöÂÜçÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÊó∂Èó¥ËøõË°åÂ§ÑÁêÜÔºåË∞¢Ë∞¢ÔºÅ

FAQ

QÔºö‰∏∫‰Ωï‰∏çÊîØÊåÅ Android 8.0 ‰ª•‰∏ãÁâàÊú¨Ôºü
